translations.english_saheeh: I swear by this city [i.e., Makkah]
translations.english_hilali_khan: 1. I swear by this city (Makkah);
translations.english_rwwad: I do swear by this city [of Makkah] –

footnotes.english_hilali_khan:
(V.90:2)
a) Narrated Ibn ‘Abbâs رضي الله عنهما: On the day of the conquest of Makkah, Allâh’s Messenger صلى الله عليه وسلم said, "Allâh has made this town a sanctuary. Its thorny bushes should not be cut, its game should not be chased, and its fallen things should not be picked up except by one who would announce them publicly." (Sahih Al-Bukhari, Vol.2, Hadith No. 657)
b) See the footnote of (V.2:191).

translations.english_saheeh: And you, [O Muḥammad], are free of restriction in this city
translations.english_hilali_khan: And you are free (from sin, and to punish the enemies of Islâm on the Day of the conquest) in this city (Makkah).[1]
translations.english_rwwad: and you are free of restriction [for a while] in this city –

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1924]- Said to be Adam (upon him be peace) .

translations.english_saheeh: And [by] the father[1924] and that which was born [of him],
translations.english_hilali_khan: And by the begetter (i.e. Adam عليه السلام) and that which he begot (i.e. his progeny).
translations.english_rwwad: and by every parent and offspring,

translations.english_saheeh: We have certainly created man into hardship.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, We have created man in toil.
translations.english_rwwad: We have created man in hardship.

arabic_text: أَيَحۡسَبُ أَن لَّن يَقۡدِرَ عَلَيۡهِ أَحَدٞ

translations.english_saheeh: Does he think that never will anyone overcome him?
translations.english_hilali_khan: Does he think that none can overcome him?
translations.english_rwwad: Does he think that none can ever have power over him?

translations.english_saheeh: He says, "I have spent wealth in abundance."
translations.english_hilali_khan: He says (boastfully): "I have wasted wealth in abundance!"
translations.english_rwwad: He says, “I have squandered enormous wealth!”

translations.english_saheeh: Does he think that no one has seen him?
translations.english_hilali_khan: Does he think that none sees him?
translations.english_rwwad: Does he think that no one sees him?

translations.english_saheeh: Have We not made for him two eyes?
translations.english_hilali_khan: Have We not made for him two eyes,
translations.english_rwwad: Have We not given him two eyes,

translations.english_saheeh: And a tongue and two lips?
translations.english_hilali_khan: And a tongue and two lips?
translations.english_rwwad: and a tongue and two lips,

translations.english_saheeh: And have shown him the two ways?[1925]
translations.english_hilali_khan: And shown him the two ways (good and evil)?
translations.english_rwwad: and shown him the two ways [of right and wrong]?

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1926]- i.e., the steep incline or obstacle. In other words, he has not spent in the cause of Allāh but only boasts of spending in front of others.

translations.english_saheeh: But he has not broken through the difficult pass.[1926]
translations.english_hilali_khan: But he has not attempted to pass on the path that is steep (i.e. the path which will lead to goodness and success).
translations.english_rwwad: Yet he did not make his way through the steep path,

translations.english_saheeh: And what can make you know what is [breaking through] the difficult pass?
translations.english_hilali_khan: And what will make you know the path that is steep?
translations.english_rwwad: and how do you know what the steep path is?

footnotes.english_hilali_khan: (V.90:13) Narrated Abu Hurairah رضي الله عنه: The Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم said: "Whoever frees a Muslim slave, Allâh will save all the parts of his body from the (Hell) Fire, as he has freed the body-parts of the slave." (Sahih Al-Bukhari, Vol.3, Hadith No.693).

translations.english_saheeh: It is the freeing of a slave
translations.english_hilali_khan: (It is) freeing a neck (slave)[2]
translations.english_rwwad: It is freeing a slave,

arabic_text: أَوۡ إِطۡعَٰمٞ فِي يَوۡمٖ ذِي مَسۡغَبَةٖ

translations.english_saheeh: Or feeding on a day of severe hunger
translations.english_hilali_khan: Or giving food in a day of hunger (famine),
translations.english_rwwad: or giving food on a day of hunger,

translations.english_saheeh: An orphan of near relationship
translations.english_hilali_khan: To an orphan near of kin.
translations.english_rwwad: to an orphan relative,

translations.english_saheeh: Or a needy person in misery
translations.english_hilali_khan: Or to a Miskîn (poor) cleaving to dust (out of misery).
translations.english_rwwad: or to a needy person in misery,

arabic_text: ثُمَّ كَانَ مِنَ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ وَتَوَاصَوۡاْ بِٱلصَّبۡرِ وَتَوَاصَوۡاْ بِٱلۡمَرۡحَمَةِ
phonetic: 90.17 Thumma Kāna Mina Al-Ladhīna 'Āmanū Wa Tawāşaw Biş-Şabri Wa Tawāşaw Bil-Marĥamahi

translations.english_saheeh: And then being among those who believed and advised one another to patience and advised one another to compassion.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then he became one of those who believed (in the Islamic Monotheism) and recommended one another to perseverance and patience, and (also) recommended one another to pity and compassion.
translations.english_rwwad: then [most importantly] to be one of those who believe and exhort one another to patience and exhort one another to compassion.

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1927]- Or "the companions of good fortune," i.e., those who receive their records in their right hands and proceed to Paradise.

translations.english_saheeh: Those are the companions of the right.[1927]
translations.english_hilali_khan: They are those on the Right Hand (i.e. the dwellers of Paradise),
translations.english_rwwad: Such are the people of the Right.

arabic_text: وَٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ بِـَٔايَٰتِنَا هُمۡ أَصۡحَٰبُ ٱلۡمَشۡـَٔمَةِ
phonetic: 90.19 Wa Al-Ladhīna Kafarū Bi'āyātinā Hum 'Aşĥābu Al-Mash'amahi

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1928]- Or "the companions of ill fortune," i.e., those who receive their records in their left hands and proceed to Hell.

translations.english_saheeh: But they who disbelieved in Our signs - those are the companions of the left.[1928]
translations.english_hilali_khan: But those who disbelieved in Our Ayât (proofs, evidence, verses, lessons, signs, revelations, etc.), they are those on the Left Hand (the dwellers of Hell).
translations.english_rwwad: As for those who reject Our signs, they are the people of the Left,

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1929]- The cover over Hell will be sealed and locked, containing its fire and its inhabitants.
footnotes.english_hilali_khan:
(V.90:20) "Therein breathing out with deep sighs and roaring will be their portion, and therein they will hear not. **" [The Qur’ân, Verse 21:100]
**Ibn Mas‘ûd رضي الله عنه recited this Verse and then said: "When those (who are destined to remain in the Hell-fire forever) will be thrown in the Hell-fire, each of them will be put in a separate Tabût (Box) of Fire, so that he will not see anyone punished in the Hell-fire except he himself." Then Ibn Mas‘ûd recited this Verse (V.21:100). [Tafsîr Ibn Kathîr, Tabarî and Qurtubî].

translations.english_saheeh: Over them will be fire closed in.[1929]
translations.english_hilali_khan: The Fire will be shut over them (i.e. they will be enveloped by the Fire without any opening or window or outlet.[3]
translations.english_rwwad: who will be locked up in the Fire.
